authors.headline: Head of Chemistry at LinXis Pharmaceuticals

profile_positions.description:
Leading chemist responsible for all chemistry-related issues at LinXis.
Development of Pt(II)-based LinXis linker technology platform for antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs), accompanied by interesting discoveries in the Pt-chemistry. 
Currently, three patent applications (first inventor on two of them), two processes developed from lab to multigram scale, five publications (first and corresponding author on two of them), one publication is in preparation. For a recent publication in Angewandte  Chemie that appeared with a front image, see: https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/anie.202011593. 
For a recent publication in Green Chemistry that appeared with a front image, see: https://pubs.rsc.org/en/content/articlelanding/2020/gc/c9gc03130h#!divAbstract.
profile_positions.title: Head of Chemistry

profile_positions.description: Development of drug-antibody conjugates (ADCs) based on novel Lx technology
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Leading postdoc responsible for the synthetic part in an inderdisciplinary project "Evaluation of potential of functionalized ceramic membranes in organic solvent nanofiltrations (OSN)". https://esites.vito.be/sites/funmem4affinity/Pages/Home.aspx
Supervision of an experienced coworker. Collaboration with a research institute VITO (Vlaamse instelling voor technologisch onderzoek).
Design and synthesis of tailor made phosphanes and NHC-Pd complexes.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Process development for the preparation of enantiomerically pure compounds
From laboratory to multikilogram scale
Co-developed a truly novel industrial 100+ kg scale process for the chiral resolution of D-arginine (chemical purity: ≥ 98%; enantiomeric ratio:  ≥ 99:1)
profile_positions.title: Development Chemist

profile_positions.description:
Contract research
Synthetic chemistry
Catalysis
Process optimization
Large-scale synthesis
profile_positions.title: Research Chemist

profile_positions.description:
Synthetic organic chemistry
Development of one-pot reactions
Strong background in heterocyclic chemistry
Cross-coupling
Kinase inhibitors
Natural products
Collaboration with Merck Serono on the synthesis of variolin B analogs
PhD thesis: http://docserv.uni-duesseldorf.de/servlets/DerivateServlet/Derivate-20537/Dissertation_Merkul_2011_PDFA.pdf.
profile_positions.title: Scientific Assistant

profile_positions.description: Collaboration on design and synthesis of novel kinase inhibitors (oncology). Eight patent applications with three granted patents.
